body:
<!-- Describe the issue -->
<!--- What behavior did you expect? -->
**Expected behaviour:** IBD without issues. Using 3.5" WD Blue HDD (500GB) attached to Laptop via SATA to USB 3 adapter. CPU is at 20% max.

<!--- What was the actual behavior (provide screenshots if the issue is GUI-related)? -->
**Actual behaviour:** After around 4.78% / block file blk00057.dat in the `blocks/` folder, it fails with the following error in `debug.log`:
`LevelDB read failure: Corruption: block checksum mismatch`

<!-- What version of Bitcoin Core are you using, where did you get it (website, self-compiled, etc)? -->
This happens both on Bitcoin Core 0.16.1 and 0.16.2

<!-- What type of machine are you observing the error on (OS/CPU and disk type)? -->
Machine: MacBook Pro, macOS 10.13

<!-- Any extra information that might be useful in the debugging process. -->
<!--- This is normally the contents of a `debug.log` or `config.log` file. Raw text or a link to a pastebin type site are preferred. -->
Output from debug.log:
2018-08-19 18:20:56 LevelDB read failure: Corruption: block checksum mismatch: /Volumes/WD500/Bitcoin/chainstate/000466.ldb
2018-08-19 18:20:56 Corruption: block checksum mismatch: /Volumes/WD500/Bitcoin/chainstate/000466.ldb
2018-08-19 18:21:17 Error reading from database: Database corrupted

**Regarding the HDD health:**
I've run `smartctl --test long` and the output was: 

SMART Self-test log structure revision number 1
Num  Test_Description    Status                  Remaining  LifeTime(hours)  LBA_of_first_error
\# 1  Extended offline    Completed without error       00%      2160         -
title: Failed IBD after block file blk00057.dat
